title: Honestly we really should just revert runes
body:
Core complaitns

-Damage creep is to high
-No defensive runes
-Snow balling feels insane

1-All the most popular runes involve more damage and offensive stats
2-Defensive rune tree sucks dick, for than you miss out on the great special abilities that the offensive rune trees give you
3- Half of the runes involve stacks that you get through kills, and are worthless if they don't stack, which puts the team that is behind at a even great disadvantage for they can't get their stacks.

replies.body:
I think one of the things that's keeping the balance team from outright reverting them is season 7.

Season 7, the beginning, had complaints about the masteries as well. There was complaining that we were in a damage meta and that masteries were the biggest contributor to this. A big part of it was all the %damage increases that were loaded into the ferocity and cunning trees.

the other big part was brand and zyra dominating the support role and topscoring damage every game.

The masteries were fixed at some point though, when they outright nerfed the %damage increases all around the trees and the only problem that existed with the game then became ardent censer.

I can only assume that the reason why the refuse to just revert to the old system when it was functionally perfection, is because they believe that they can fix the current runes the same way.


Personally I think one of the best changes they could do, is to remove the passive stats (attackspeed, ad/ap adaptive/flat health) and just put that power into our starting items. One of the things we were going to get with runes reforged was a rework to our starting items (a dorans blade variant that came with attackspeed for instance) but it never came because of time constraints.
I would kill your cat in a sacrifice to satan to have old runes back...

Old runes and mastery tree was also a LOT of freedom and more fun to play with. Now you're literally stuck with only playing with 1 run set for all champions. (Champ only uses 1 can't change it or its shit.) 

It's annoying. Before you could have whatever runes you wanted for any champions and it would work. Same with the old masteries the customization was amazing. Now theres none.

I think you have old and new mixed up. Old runes and masteries everyone literally only ran 1 set. You could reasonably hit challenger with just 2 rune pages, just swapping armor/level for MR/level and base armor for base mr depending on lane matchup.

New runes and masteries every champ in the game has at least 2 keystones they can and need to know how to use, and most can run 3+.

The only people who think old runes had any customization are the people who didnt know old runes well. There was literally only 1 correct option.

I personally vote that we remove runes altogether at this point. For sure, the old system was better than the current one, but it had some serious issues as well, namely that the stat customization options it offered were fixed in the vast majority of cases. Keystones from the previous seasons also warped gameplay, whereas the masteries beforehand all offered less visible bonuses that may have well been more stats or item passives (many of the new ones could be the latter as well). In every case, there was little choice involved, because people still gravitated towards around one set build per champion. Cutting out all of this, and instead allowing champions better customization within matches, I think should be the way to go.

Here's the core issue: Popularity

It isn't that you don't have options. It's that people don't *want* to use them. For example, if you're a scaling marksman, you can use Resolve Secondary if you're up against some strong all-ins. You could also use Taste of Blood from the Domination tree alongside Fleet Footwork to try to sustain through lane. However, **most** people will still go Sorcery for Gathering Storm. Sure, it's a good late game rune, but you just forwent all sustain/defensive options for more damage. That's not the game's fault. That's your decision making.

Also can people stop whining about the Resolve Tree? It houses some of the best runes in the game, and it's either standard or "pretty dang good" on almost any champ.

its easy to give up.

the old rune system wasnt any better. most people ran exactly the same rune page every single time. it was pretty much just static base stats.

the mastery system was basically the exact same as the current rune system, that was just as solved as the current runes.

having two separate customization systems was outdated design.

what they can do from here:

- further tweak and change the currently existing runes
- add new rune pathes to add more variety to champions who dont have a lot of options (especially a second defensive rune tree feels like its needed)
- change the way base stats are bound to rune pathes
- do a rework of starting items like they originally planned to give people more options for lvl 1 stat customization.

Some what agree with the solve state on runes. No matter what riot does for the most part runes/masteries will be solved, however in the old system you had to more points of variation. You could go 6/3 or 5/4 on glyphs which added more depth you could try to really mid/max. It also allowed for some really creative/funny builds like the all ad rune pages.

In the new system you might change your runes when the enemy is picking all burst champions to include resolve but otherwise it feels very same-like. Every champion with aery uses it the same way same with lethal tempo and so on. In the old system runes changed the stats that each champion used differently. The only example of new doing this is when the champion is getting way to much out of the runes.
Why not just keep the new runes and bring back the old runes to fine tune your character
